title: For a Riot member to respond to
body:
Question is it bannable to ban someone's champion pick the same way it's bannable to take a role that wasn't yours?

EG. i hover Ekko, and someone bans it, is that a ban worthy offense?

replies.body:
I would definitely report in under "unsportsmanlike" and include details in the comment box. It's not a specified behaviour like say verbal abuse, but it is definitely negative behaviour and something I'd easily consider reportable. I mean it's just a dick move.

As for whether it's punishable, likely not on its own. If they had a solid history of negativity, or were doing it every game, then yes it would be, but for a couple games, unlikely it'd be punished by itself.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=y8EXaAJ9,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-12T13:13:06.350+0000)

> I would definitely report in under "unsportsmanlike" and include details in the comment box. It's not a specified behaviour like say verbal abuse, but it is definitely negative behaviour and something I'd easily consider reportable. I mean it's just a dick move.
> 
> As for whether it's punishable, likely not on its own. If they had a solid history of negativity, or were doing it every game, then yes it would be, but for a couple games, unlikely it'd be punished by itself.

Certainly agree with this.  

Would also like to add that sometimes it may not be targeted at you! They could be banning the champion for the sake of:

* Being Red Side - Not having first pick of a very strong champion such as Ekko at the moment sees him banned away from the enemy.
* Pick Order - If you are last picking Ekko and someone in your team doesn't think you will get him before the other team someone may ban it away. 
* Panic Pick - Some people have habitual bans which they do when they realize at 10seconds they have to ban or risk dodge. Thus they panic and ignore your pick.

Just a thing or two to think about as not everyone's a bad guy!
